arm_group.description: subjects with ALS who are undergoing a percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy
subjects without ALS who are undergoing a percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the project is to obtain skin and adipose tissue samples from patients with
      ALS to develop new diagnostic and prognostic markers of the disease.  These samples will be
      obtained when percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy (PEG) is performed as part of their
      standard of care.  Skin and adipose tissue samples will also be obtained from disease
      control subjects who require a PEG as part of their standard of care.

clinical_study.brief_title: Identification of Diagnostic And Prognostic Biomarkers From Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) Skin and Adipose Samples

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  for ALS patients, subjects must be diagnosed with definite ALS according to the El
             Escorial Critera (EEC)

          -  all subjects must be diagnosed with a condition requiring PEG (percutaneous
             endoscopic gastrostomy) tube insertion

          -  subjects must be older than 18 years of age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  children 18 years old and younger

study_pop.textblock:
Patients at the Carolinas Neuromuscular/ALS-MDA Center and patients at Carolinas Medical
        Center.

facility.name: Carolinas Medical Center - Dept of Neurology

clinical_study.official_title: Identification of Diagnostic and Prognostic Biomarkers From Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) Skin and Adipose Samples

overall_official.affiliation: Carolinas Medical Center - Dept of Gastroenterology

primary_outcome.measure: Abundance levels of the known messenger RNA transcriptome  of skin  and adipose tissue samples (measured by gene expression profiling)
primary_outcome.time_frame: After tissue has been collected from study subjects.  Data will be analyzed at 1 year.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in abundance of or post-translational modification of proteins (measured by proteomics)
primary_outcome.time_frame: After tissue has been collected from study subjects.  Data will be analzyed at year 1 after primary outcome data has been reviewed and analyzed

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director, Neuromuscular/ ALS-MDA Center and Neuromuscular/ ALS Research Laboratory
